title: Brexit deadlock: Jeremy Corbyn's refusal to back election leaves EU decision on delay in limbo
text:
Election confusion is expected to delay an EU decision on a Brexit extension today, as Emmanuel Macron is refusing to back a January deadline.

Amelie de Montchalin, France's Europe Minister, said on Thursday: "If there are elections that are not just desired but announced, organised, well then we will be able to take decisions."

"We need facts in order to make a decision," she added, "We will not deal in political fiction."

Jeremy Corbyn said he wanted to wait until the EU27 granted an extension before agreeing to the election suggested by Prime Minister Boris Johnson, but his stance has jeopardised agreement on the delay to the Oct 31 Brexit deadline.

Mr Macron has been a lone voice in...
description: Election confusion is expected to delay an EU decision on a Brexit extension today, as Emmanuel Macron is refusing to back a January deadline.
